title: North of England flooding - BBC News
summary: river ouse stabilises in york as pm visits flood-hit areas .
people advised not to travel by rail in cumbria , lancashire and yorkshire .
thousands of homes evacuated across the north of england .
floods cause major landline phone problems .

documents.title: our live flood coverage across the day
text: that 's all for now from our live coverage of the flooding aftermath across the north of england on monday 28 december .
if there are any major flood developments through the night , we 'll bring you the very latest news right here .
otherwise , join us again from 07:00 on tuesday as we being you up-to-date news , views , travel and weather updates from those areas worst-hit by the flooding across the north .
author: Martin Coldrick
BBC Local Live

documents.title: the view from above : gb astronaut tim peake 's concern over flooding
text: british astronaut tim peake has expressed his concern from the international space station for those affected by floods in his home country .
the former army pilot took this of the uk as he passed overhead , posting it on his twitter account .
in his tweet , tim says : `` passed over uk today - thoughts are with all those affected by flooding in northern england . ''
passed over uk today - thoughts are with all those affected by flooding in northern england .

documents.title: in a few minutes of rest amid the flood clean-up
text: as the clean-up operation across the north of england continues tonight following the floods which have hit areas in cumbria , lancashire , greater manchester , west and north yorkshire , here 's a which sums up the effort going into getting things back to normal .
it shows soldiers from the 2nd battalion , duke of lancaster 's regiment , grabbing a brief rest from helping with flood relief in york today .
take a look at more from the day here .

documents.title: york is functioning after the flooding - but only just
text: over the course of the day , river levels here in york have fallen .
clear tide marks can now be seen around the city .
but by no means is the emergency operation over , with crews still working here this evening and long into the night .
york 's functioning , but only just .
floodwater 's been causing disruption to business , with cash machines not working , card payments ca n't be processed and real chaos caused to the communications network in the city .
author: Katherine Downes
Reporter, BBC News

documents.title: flood-hit sport in north of england to benefit from £ 400k fund
text: an emergency fund made available by sport england last month to help restore flooded pitches , clubhouses and other facilities in the wake of storm desmond has been doubled to £ 400,000 to reflect the latest flooding across the north of england .
the national lottery cash will now be available for clubs , charities and councils in all areas affected by storm eva .
jennie price , sport england chief executive , says : when major incidents like this happen , the priority must be making sure people are safe , and vital public services are back up and running .
`` but we know from the floods in 2014 that people want to get their lives back to normal as quickly as possible , and this includes the sports facilities they use every week . ''

documents.title: your flooding at castleford and allerton bywater
text: thanks to kiel murphy for sending in these of flooding near castleford and allerton bywater in west yorkshire earlier today .
kiel says it 's `` quite shocking '' to see scenes like this , with parts of the area `` under a good 4ft of water '' from the river aire .

documents.title: december timeline : flooding in the north of england
text: with the flooding clean-up well under way across northern england , but with yellow `` be aware '' warnings for rain on wednesday already in place , here 's a look back at events so far :
5 december : storm desmond brings more than a month 's rain to parts of cumbria , leading to flooding in carlisle and other areas
12 december : river levels remain high and more than 70 flood warnings are issued amid more heavy rain
22 december : communities in cumbria flood again - some for the third time in less than a month
25 december : more than 100 flood alerts and warnings are issued across england and wales as torrential rain hits
26 december : residents in west yorkshire and lancashire are evacuated from their homes and flooding hits leeds , greater manchester and york
27 december : police in york advise hundreds of people to evacuate their homes as severe flood warnings remain in place in northern england

documents.title: selby couple ignore flood fears to tie the knot
text: there 's been some good news for one worried bride in north yorkshire who feared her wedding day was in jeopardy of being a wash-out due to the floods .
lucy and peter nickson were due to get married today at selby abbey , just 100m from the river ouse which it was feared would flood .
but it did n't - and the couple have managed to tie the knot , with guests managing to find their way to the church despite a number of roads being closed nearby .
author: Martin Coldrick
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : selby farmer takes to the water to inspect flood damage
text: a farmer with no dry land - chris elcock has swapped his tractor for a boat to inspect flooded fields near selby
@ twitterid are his fields not part of the natural flood plains that surrounds selby ?

documents.title: december rainfall breaks met office records
text: it may not come as a surprise to people in areas affected by flooding in the north of england over the past few days , but this december 's turned out to be a record-breaker .
record breaking december rainfall

documents.title: six 'severe ' flood warnings still in place across the north
text: six severe flood warnings , meaning there is a potential danger to life , remain in force across yorkshire and north-east england , the environment agency says .
a total of 46 flood warnings , meaning immediate action is required , and 25 `` be prepared '' flood alerts are also still in place , according to the agency .

documents.title: york flooding 'like stepping back 100 years '
text: the effect of flooding on york city centre is `` abysmal '' and is `` like stepping back 100 years '' , a local resident has told prime minister david cameron as he toured the flood-hit city earlier .
chris wardle , whose first-floor flat on skeldergate is currently surrounded by water , said he thanked mr cameron for his efforts with relief and told him everyone was doing a `` sterling job '' .
however , when the pm asked mr wardle when flooding last happened he told him it was only back in 2012 .
`` someone , from prime minister to the council , really needs to sort out flood defences in the city centre , '' he added .

documents.title: in flood water surrounds eggborough power station
text: this was the scene a short time ago at eggborough power station in north yorkshire .
this aerial shot shows the river aire has swamped miles of fields in the area .
author: BBC Look North, Yorkshire

documents.title: rspca rescue animals from york floods
text: officers from the rspca have also been in york to help animals caught in the floods .

the five-strong crew waded through waist-high water with an inflatable boat to save a black cat called pawsy from a home in walmgate and a further two cats called fluffy and squeakers from a house in huntington road .

rspca deputy chief inspector ben strangwood said : both of the families had been evacuated from their homes because of rising water and had reluctantly left their cats in the houses with food and drinking water .
in a strange twist of fate pawsy was actually adopted from the rspca so he 's been rescued by us twice now . ''

documents.title: watch : leeds arts centre flooding : 'the community responded so quickly '
text: the open source arts centre only opened in kirkstall road , leeds , on 21 december .
a few days later it was under a foot of water .
not only are staff there now cleaning up their building , but they 're co-ordinating volunteers , allocating them local businesses to go and help in the aftermath of the leeds flood .
about 700 people signed up in 24 hours to help out , and phil marken from the project has explained to me how they 're getting on .
author: James Vincent
Reporter BBC Look North

documents.title: pm 's £ 280m flood defence pledge 'inadequate ' - green party leader
text: the prime minister 's pledge of £ 280m for flood defences in yorkshire is `` wholly inadequate '' , the leader of the green party has said .
david cameron made the promise while visiting york to see recovery efforts following severe flooding across the north of england over the past few days .

but natalie bennett says : `` we urgently need to not just consider flood defences , but land use across catchments , plus the protection of urban areas through sustainable drainage and similar management schemes , while ending the construction of new housing estates in vulnerable areas . ''

documents.title: your aire valley flooding caught on camera
text: thanks to neville allan for sending us this photo of flooding in the aire valley , looking over cononley towards keighley , which really shows how badly the area 's been hit .
author: Martin Coldrick
BBC Local Live

documents.title: reconnection of power-cut homes continues in greater manchester and lancashire
text: electricity north west says about 850 properties remain without power in greater manchester and lancashire .
the company said about 300 customers had been reconnected today and all but the market rochdale and pioneers substations had had power restored .
a spokesman said the company was now carrying out safety checks on the remaining properties in radcliffe and croston to allow them to be reconnected .
author: Chris Long
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: troops asked to help in bradford flood clean-up
text: with the clean-up well under way in the bradford district , bradford council says it 's asked for the army to step in to help .
we have requested 30 troops for 28th , 29th and 30th december to help clear debris and provide preventative support
@ twitterid where will they be tomorrow please ?
@ twitterid get the unemployed work dodgers doing it ! !
plenty of them in bradford !

documents.title: roads remain closed in cumbria
text: the following roads remain closed in cumbria due to surface water flooding according to the county 's police :
.. a6070 at holme park quarry.. c1015 rickarby park road.. rickerby park from brampton road , carlisle , to linstock.. newby east to little corby road
supt mark pannone , of cumbria constabulary , said : whilst the county 's road network is returning to a form of normality there are still a number of closures that motorists need to be aware of .
i would advise those who have already been affected by the floods to ensure they keep up to date with the latest weather forecasts and environment agency advice . ''

documents.title: clean-up continues in rochdale after flooding
text: a clean-up is taking place in rochdale after flooding hit the town over the weekend .

documents.title: archbishop of york praises flood response
text: the archbishop of york has praised the `` tremendous spirit '' of everyone who has responded to the floods across northern england .
dr john sentamu released a statement as the undercroft of bishopthorpe palace was being pumped out of water from the river ouse .
he said : `` as expected , the undercroft in my home here at bishopthorpe palace is flooded again .

`` we are fortunate however that back in the 13th century they built with flooding in mind , such that when the water subsides it soon washes through the original flood drains made for the purpose . ''

documents.title: kirkstall road clean-up 'in full swing '
text: completely different scenes here on kirkstall road in leeds today .
the street is lined with ruined furniture and stock from the shops hit by the floods .
people are mopping water out of their properties and stood in small groups outside , talking about the damage .
the atmosphere is one of a clean-up operation in full swing as the road recovers from the day it turned into a river .
author: Lauren Potts
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'stay away from flood water '
text: remember to stay away from flood water .
six inches of fast flowing water can knock you off your feet # floodaware

documents.title: flooding at kirkstall arts centre
text: we 've been sent footage of flooding at an arts centre in kirkstall , leeds .

documents.title: storm desmond appeal to help flood victims
text: the organisers of a lancashire flood appeal set up to support people affected by storm desmond have said it will be extended to help those hit by this weekend 's flooding .
the lancashire flood appeal was launched by the community foundation for lancashire on 8 december and aimed to help up to 1,000 people affected by storm desmond .
organisers said it `` now extends to help those victims of flooding in lancashire over christmas , especially in the chorley area '' .
author: Chris Long
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: york 'looking like venice '
text: walmgate in york resembles venice in places .
author: Phil Bodmer
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: travel : a19 closed due to flooding
text: the a19 is closed between the a63 junction in burn and the a645 weeland road junction in eggborough because of flooding .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: pm pledges £ 280m for yorkshire flood defences
text: prime minister david cameron has pledged £ 280m for yorkshire flood defences .

documents.title: hospital has 'reduced phone service '
text: south tyneside district hospital is warning patients to be patient when ringing .

michelle arrowsmith , chief operating officer at south tyneside nhs foundation trust said : `` we currently have some problems with phone lines due to the recent flooding , and we have a reduced number of lines into the hospital via our switchboard .
`` please bear with us when trying to contact us , we will be able to answer your call but it may take some time . ''
the public can still ring the hospital switchboard on 0191 4041000 or 0191 4283992 .

documents.title: council worker takes a break from flood recovery effort
text: a well earned break to dry off socks .
removal of water around wellington st continues @ twitterid @ twitterid

documents.title: rivers foss and ouse flooding from above
text: rising waters in york are reported to have peaked and while more rain is forecast for wednesday , the environment agency says the city is safe from further flooding for now .
news has this video of the rivers foss and ouse from above .

documents.title: more of the flooding aftermath in york
text: here are some more of the scenes around york today .

documents.title: more than 2,000 leeds homes affected by the heavy rain
text: leeds city council says more than 2,000 homes and 400 businesses have been affected by the heavy rain .
the authority said most of the water had now receded and teams were out tackling priority areas .

documents.title: prime minister defends flood prevention funding
text: david cameron has defended funding for flood prevention during his visit to york to see recovery efforts .
he rejected claims there was a `` north/south divide '' in efforts to prevent flooding .

he said : `` here in yorkshire we 've spent almost £ 100m on flood defences and we 're planning to spend another £ 280m but of course that 's no comfort for the people who 've been flooded here in york and our hearts go out to them . ''

documents.title: submerged vehicles in huntington , york
text: parking on huntington canal , york floods right now

documents.title: relief fund set up to help victims , says archbishop of york
text: the archbishop of york dr john sentamu says a special relief fund has been set up to help people affected by the flooding .
speaking on bbc radio york , the archbishop praised the compassion showed by emergency services and volunteers .
he said he would be spending the rest of the week visiting affected communities and anyone who wanted to help could donate to the york disaster fund .

documents.title: drivers warned to stay away from contaminated road
text: a clean-up is under way in kirkstall road , in leeds , which remains closed .
police are asking drivers to stay away as the roads are contaminated with oil and other products .

documents.title: village in danger due to river flood defence 'gap '
text: a breach in river defences near a lancashire village could see it suffer further flooding , the environment agency has warned .
the agency said the river douglas south of croston had `` overwhelmed '' defences , causing a `` gap '' .
they added they would be `` coming up rapidly with an emergency plan '' to carry out repairs .

south ribble 's conservative mp seema kennedy said she would be asking the government to `` look again '' at flood defence spending and `` maybe reallocate resources in the environment agency and think about what we are doing , quite literally , upstream '' .
author: Chris Long
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: christmas flooding : your
text: the arrival of storm eva meant there were more than 100 flood alerts on christmas day across england and wales .
by monday , there were 500 .
many people had to move out of their homes , cars lay abandoned and animals were bewildered .
here is a selection of photos sent in by bbc website readers .

documents.title: higher river levels expected in selby
text: selby this morning .
they 've passed the early peak but expecting high river levels again this evening
@ twitterid keep safe
@ twitterid hola sweetie .
i ca n't believe how these people have suffered with the floods .
it 's heartbreaking .
xxx

documents.title: number of severe flood warnings reduced
text: the number of severe flood warnings across the north of england has now reduced to nine .
the environment agency say six remain in force in the north east and three in the north west .

documents.title: mp calls for oversea aid funds to be used to prevent flooding
text: rochdale 's labour mp simon danczuk says more needs to be done to prevent flooding , including diverting overseas aid funds .
`` why do we spend money in bangladesh when it needs spending in great britain ?
what we need to do is to sort out the problems which are occurring here and not focus so much on developing countries .
that has to be our priority , '' he said .
he was speaking after rochdale and nearby littleborough were hit by heavy flooding at the weekend .
author: Chris Long
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: community hall open for flood donations
text: bell farm social hall in roche avenue , york , has opened for people to donate items for those affected by the flooding .

documents.title: housing association praises 'instinctive community spirit '
text: a housing association in bury has praised the `` instinctive community spirit '' that is helping residents clear up after flooding .
irwell valley housing association and their contractors adamas have been `` out again this morning assisting over 100 residents affected by floods in the area '' , a spokeswoman says .
ivha managing director cath mustafa says the `` resilience of everyone affected and the instinctive community spirit to pull together at such a difficult time is truly astonishing '' .
author: Chris Long
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: salvation army supplying food for baildon victims
text: salvation army providing food parcels for flood victims in # baildon - the river aire has done some serious damage here .
@ twitterid please please do n't bring a food parcel to me or send a politician , doing just fine on my own .
@ twitterid everywhere is covered in a black sludge .
outside my flat there are ladies items hanging from the trees .
it 's surreal .

documents.title: bt working 'flat out ' to restore phones
text: engineers for bt are working `` flat out '' to restore phone and broadband services across yorkshire and the north east after flooding damaged the york bt exchange .
a spokesman said : `` severe flooding in the yorkshire area has resulted in the loss of some phone and broadband services .
`` the york bt exchange has been damaged by flood water and openreach engineers are currently repairing damage to the building 's power supply .
`` our engineers are working flat out to restore services as soon as possible and we 're sorry for the inconvenience caused . ''

documents.title: david cameron spends morning in york
text: david cameron has spent the morning in york to see the damage caused by the floods .
he 's been meeting emergency teams at fulford road police station where a specialist command centre to deal with flooding has been set up .

documents.title: aerial shots capture flooding in york
text: the bbc news helicopter captured these shots of the latest situation in york and its surrounding areas , including cawood .

documents.title: restaurant owner 'devastated ' by flooding
text: restaurant owner naiya khatri says she has been `` completely devastated '' by the flooding .
she and her husband recently took over 29 states , an indian restaurant in the town centre .
`` the restaurant is flooded with nearly 5ft of water inside the property .
our kitchen , bar equipment , furniture and fixtures are damaged .
my partner is still trying to get through to the insurance company . ''

documents.title: north yorkshire hospitals ' temporary phone number
text: phone lines have been affected at all york teaching hospital nhs foundation trust sites .
nhs england said incoming calls to sites at york , scarborough , malton and selby had been affected .
a temporary switchboard has been established - 01723 385088

documents.title: greater manchester fire service 'rescued 1,000 in 24 hours '
text: a greater manchester fire and rescue service spokeswoman says they received more than 300 flood-related calls across the weekend .
she says it is believed crews `` rescued up to 1,000 people in less than 24 hours when water levels rose so rapidly yesterday that whole towns were cut off '' .
more than 1,100 homes in the area remain without power following flooding .
author: Chris Long
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: raf helicopter transports barrier equipment for repairs
text: an raf chinook helicopter has been drafted in to transport equipment needed to repair the foss barrier in york .
four out of eight pumps were not working because electrical equipment used to power them failed when the control room was inundated with water .
the pumps are expected to be working later this afternoon .

documents.title: floods cause phone faults
text: bt reports there have been numerous phone faults caused by flooding in leeds and york .
click here to see which areas are affected .

documents.title: greater manchester : thousand homes remain without power
text: more than 1,100 homes in greater manchester remain without power following flooding in the area across the weekend .
electricity north west said about 680 customers in bury and 480 in rochdale were still cut off .
the company has reconnected more than 24,750 customers in the past two days .

documents.title: council has temporary phone number
text: city of york council says there 's a temporary number and email for its customer centre - 07500 100398 or flood @ york.gov.uk .
due to problems with telecomms in york we have a temporary number & email for our customer centre : 07500 100398 or flood @ york.gov.uk

documents.title: 'business as usual ' for york once recovered
text: chris steward , city of york council leader , says it will be business as usual once the city has recovered from the deluge .
`` we as a city cope with flooding brilliantly .
it is business as usual , it 's just these isolated couple of days that we 're saying do n't travel here . ''

documents.title: almost 200 incidents for fire service
text: north yorkshire fire and rescue service says it has attended almost 200 incidents , mostly flooding related , since early on boxing day .
they have rescued people trapped in vehicles in flood water and those who have been trapped in properties
crews are currently in malton and york carrying out pumping operations .

documents.title: north yorkshire roads hit by flooding
text: twenty three roads are closed in the centre of york with dozens more closed across north yorkshire .

in york , the only access for pedestrians to the city centre and the station side of the river foss and river ouse from fishergate is via walmgate , densis street and on to piccadilly via the reynards garage site .
see the latest road closures in york below.some roads have reopened.please take care when driving to , or around , york
@ twitterid congratulations on writing a great uk gov tweet .
( ranked 1st for dec 28 . )

documents.title: some flood warnings lifted
text: flood warnings have been lifted in some parts of keighley and the worth valley as the district battles to recover from the weekend 's torrential rain .
author: Keighley News

documents.title: greater manchester : clear-up under way
text: police say the flood operation in greater manchester has now turned into a `` recovery '' phase , with water levels falling .

documents.title: plea for help as flood-hit communities recover
text: in west yorkshire , the clear-up is continuing in the calder valley , leeds and keighley .
in mytholmroyd the devastation is all around me .
people are trying to themselves up and get on with their lives but the message they 've got today is that they need help to try to do that .
author: Richard Edwards
Journalist, BBC Radio Leeds

documents.title: new police numbers
text: the regular police non-emergency number 101 is suffering faults caused by the flooding in leeds and york .
in an emergency people should still call 999 , but here are new temporary non-emergency numbers for :

documents.title: respite from rain but forecasters warn more to come
text: the worst-hit areas will have some respite from rain today but forecasters have warned there may be worse to come as more bad weather is set for the middle of the week .
rain will batter the north of england on wednesday with up to three inches falling on high ground and potentially in excess of 4.7ins in exposed locations .
the met office has issued yellow warnings for rain on wednesday in north west england , north east england , yorkshire and humber , wales and northern ireland .

documents.title: david cameron to visit swamped communities
text: prime minister david cameron is expected to visit flood-hit areas of northern england later this morning .
during his visits , the prime minister is likely to face questions about government funding of flood defences after environment secretary liz truss said some had been `` overwhelmed '' .

documents.title: rising waters reported to have peaked in york
text: the river ouse has stabilised in york with the environment agency saying the city is safe from further flooding for the time being .
city of york council have said plans for further evacuations would now not happen .
thirty two flood warnings are still in place across north yorkshire with six severe warnings in york .

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live flood coverage
text: hello and welcome to bbc local live in the north of england on monday 28 december 2015 .
i 'll be with you with the latest news and on the flooding situation across the north of england .
please send me you news , and comments via leeds.locallive @ bbc.co.uk
author: Alex Moss
BBC Local Live

documents.title: flooding in the north of england : a recap of sunday 's key points
text: you can keep up to date with the latest on the flooding in northern england via our main news story .
for now , here 's a quick run-down on things as they stand :
- thousands of homes have been evacuated in yorkshire and lancashire
- some power is expected to be restored to york 's river foss flood barrier on monday
- scores of flood warnings remain in place , including six severe warnings in york itself
- across north-west england some 3,000 customers remain without power - electricity north west has restored services to 23,000 people since saturday
- leeds city council leader says the cost of the flood clean-up `` will be considerable ''
author: Martin Coldrick
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your york flooding caught on camera
text: thanks to jennifer lunn for sending in these from york earlier today which pretty much sum up the sort of day it 's been across many parts of the north of england .

documents.title: north of england flooding : 'be prepared and follow advice '
text: alison baptiste , flood duty manager at the environment agency , has issued this statement : `` our thoughts are with all those who have suffered serious flooding to their homes and businesses over christmas and those who face the risk of further flooding over the coming days .
`` we still have severe flood warnings , meaning a risk to life , in force for parts of yorkshire and river levels in some areas will continue to rise throughout today and tomorrow .
`` people in these communities should continue to check their flood risk , prepare for flooding , follow the advice from emergency services and never risk driving through flood water . ''

documents.title: electricity safety advice for flood-hit properties
text: as flooding continues to affect areas across the north of england , northern powergrid has issued this advice for people who 's property has been hit and where electricity is still live :
do not enter the flooded area
if you fear water may come into your property , if safe to do so turn off your electricity supply via isolator switch or fusebox
- if possible , unplug and move any portable electronic appliances to a higher location

documents.title: calderdale town halls stay open for flood victims
text: todmorden and hebden bridge town hall are staying open throughout the night for flood victims .
for advice see faq
@ twitterid tried to drop donations off 1 hour ago , all dark no answer when i rang bell at todmorden town hall .
will try again in morning .

documents.title: york flooding : six severe flood warnings still in place
text: a total of six severe flood warnings remain in place in york - meaning there 's a danger to life .
these are :
- river foss at huntington and york
- tang hall beck at york
- river foss at huntington road and foss island
- osbaldwick beck at york
- tang hall beck at york - beckside properties
- osbaldwick beck at york - beckside properties
there are 12 less serious flood warnings in place , meaning immediate action is required .
for the full list , visit the environment agency website .

documents.title: your flooding in baildon and shipley caught on drone camera
text: thanks to chris halliday for sending in this drone .
of flooding in baildon and shipley in west yorkshire earlier today which shows just how badly hit the area 's been hit .

documents.title: manchester flooding : chief constable praises emergency services
text: the chief constable of greater manchester police has thanked the emergency services , local authorities and other organisation for their `` excellent work '' responding to the `` unprecedented '' floods which have hit the area .
chief constable ian hopkins says : `` they have been working non-stop as part of the operation to combat the flooding and have done so in very difficult conditions .
`` a lot of people have been safely evacuated from their homes and thankfully we have not had any reports of serious injuries or fatalities . ''

documents.title: archbishop praises 'modern day good samaritans '
text: the archbishop of york , dr john sentamu , says his home at bishopthorpe palace is experiencing flooding and has sent a prayer to all those affected in the region .
dr sentamu says : `` besides the shock and danger of the floods themselves , for those flooded out , the drying time and clean-up period will be long , tedious , costly , and sheer hard work .
`` it is no surprise , however , to see the people of york responding with tremendous spirit , resolve , and generosity , to the plight of their flooded neighbours at this time .
`` you are our modern day good samaritans - i salute your readiness to respond to your neighbour 's need . ''

documents.title: leeds flood pub : 'there was nothing we could do about it once it came '
text: kirkstall bridge inn in leeds has been flooded for the second time in a month after the river aire came over the flood defences yesterday .
but speaking on bbc radio leeds , pub landlord ian forster says nothing can keep a yorkshireman from his pint , and the regulars gathered to watch the water rise .
`` it was kind of funny .
we 'd all seen it coming so we were all outside waiting with a little cheer , knowing there was nothing we could do about it once it came , this torrent washing over the wall .
`` it 's hard work now .
it 's all about getting it straight to open as soon as we can .
with new year just around the corner it 's especially bad timing . ''

documents.title: roads hit by flooding in bradford district
text: bradford council has just issued this list of roads affected by flooding in the district :
- denton road and cowpasture road in ilkley are closed
- skipton road in keighley is closed
- mill hey in haworth is closed due to a hole appearing in the road
- baildon bridge is open , but green lane remains closed
- the shipley to burley-in-wharfedale road remains open

documents.title: latest on river foss flood barrier
text: some power is expected to be restored to the river foss flood barrier in york tomorrow , city of york council and the environment agency say .
water levels on the river ouse currently stand at about 5.1m .
levels on the foss will begin to fall when levels on the ouse begin falling , the environment agency says .
the level of the ouse is expected to peak on monday morning and remain high until tuesday .
author: Phil Bodmer
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: cost of leeds flooding 'will be considerable ' - council leader
text: flooding which has hit leeds over the past 24 hours has been `` unprecedented in its severity '' and the cost of the damage caused will be `` considerable '' , the labour leader of leeds city council says .
in a statement issued a short time ago , judith blake says : `` if ever the evidence was needed that cities like leeds must have the best possible comprehensive flood defences , this is it .
`` the council warned the government after several near-misses in recent years that a major flood in leeds was a catastrophe waiting to happen .
a preventable disaster like this must never happen again . ''

documents.title: river levels in castleford falling , council says
text: river levels are reducing in castleford but will continue to be monitored through the night
@ twitterid the gov was aware of my unique system to manage floods more effectively 2 ys ago- but they did nothing to protect uk 's citizen

documents.title: 'flood situation serious ' in york and selby
text: flooding in york and selby remains serious , but `` everything that needs to be done is being done '' to control the risk faced by local residents and the emergency services , north yorkshire 's police and crime commissioner julia mulligan says .
in a statement , mrs mulligan says : `` the next few hours will be critical .
in the meantime , i 'd like to thank everyone for working so hard to protect people , including many volunteers .
`` my heart also goes out to those already affected .
it may be of little comfort in some circumstances , but please be reassured that the emergency services and others are doing all they can to help keep you safe . ''

documents.title: rescue crews 'still busy ' across west yorkshire
text: rescue crews are still busy in several areas of west yorkshire dealing with the aftermath of flooding which has hit the county over the past 48 hours , west yorkshire fire service says .
crews are still in attendance pumping out at west point , wellington street , and at the itv studios on kirkstall road in leeds , and will be at both sites for the rest of the evening .
they 're also helping local residents in keighley whose homes have been affected , the fire service says .

documents.title: north of england flooding : what we know now
text: as the flooding continues to cause major problems in the north of england , here 's a recap of some of the main points today :
- thousands of homes evacuated in yorkshire and lancashire
- city of york requests 5,000 additional sandbags as river levels continue to rise
- across north-west england nearly 6,000 customers remain without power
- west yorkshire police declare a major incident after the `` worst flooding in 70 years ''
- people are advised not to travel by rail in cumbria , lancashire and yorkshire
author: Martin Coldrick
BBC Local Live

documents.title: filming over a flood gate in york
text: there 's concern that the river ouse in york will peak at more than 15ft above the normal summer levels on monday afternoon .
many people have been evacuated from their homes because of the severe flooding .
i 've been at one flood gate in the centre of the city on the river ouse to see what the situation is for myself .
watch my report here .
author: Matthew Price
BBC correspondent, York

documents.title: 'city flood defences must be built higher ' , says professor
text: british cities must do more to protect themselves from flooding like that seen in the north of england over the past two days , a professor at the university of east anglia has said .
speaking on the bbc news channel , hydro-geologist kevin hiscock said the country needs to adopt a flood risk management approach to help avoid a repetition of recent flooding .
`` when you look at the urban centres - where people live - we need to build our defences higher there and protect those people who are very vulnerable .
`` but in the wider catchment we can adopt softer engineering approaches .
we can plant woodland to create wet woodland on the floodplain , we can think about recreating meanders in our rivers to hold back some of the water , to reduce the flood peak . ''

documents.title: electricity substation pumped out
text: floodwater is being pumped out of a york electricity substation which is one of the city 's main power supply sources , northern powergrid has confirmed .
the melrosegate primary substation supplies about 50,000 properties in york and northern powergrid says it 's working with the fire service to pump out water which has started to enter the site .
in a statement , the company says : `` the pumps are managing the current water levels .
the existing flood defences are helping reduce the flow and the on-site team continues to closely monitor rising water levels . ''

documents.title: north west flooding : free hot food and drink offered to victims
text: we 've provided free hot food and drink to 1,700 people in # radcliffe # bury # padiham today # flooding

documents.title: 'nearly 6,000 still without electricity ' in north west
text: about 20,000 electricity customers have seen their power restored since severe flooding hit the north west of england yesterday , power firm electricity north west has confirmed .
however , about 5,940 customers are still waiting for their electricity supply to be restored and some of those may not have power until monday due to the severity of the flooding .

documents.title: praise for 'random acts of kindness ' in york
text: johnny hayes , independent councillor for the micklegate ward on city of york council , says he 's seen `` many random acts of kindness '' today as the city coped with major flooding .

in a statement , he says : `` people helping strangers to protect their homes or help them move , rooms being made available in homes to welcome those who are flooded , many donations of supplies for flood prevention or food , a constant flow of tea and coffee and many hugs of support .
`` people gave up their christmas holiday to help .
i am so proud to have seen our community pull together to help those who desperately needed our support . ''

documents.title: leeds pub flooded for second time in weeks
text: pubgoers in kirkstall , leeds , are being asked to don their wellies on monday morning and head to one local pub to help the clean-up operation after it was flooded .
the kirkstall bridge inn , which was last flooded just over a month ago , has again had its downstairs bar and cellar submerged under water from the nearby river aire .
staff at the pub are asking people to lend a hand as they have `` a big job ahead of us '' .

documents.title: clean-up progressing whalley
text: many hands have made light work in whalley , lancashire , today where the post-flood clean-up was well under way .
it 's more than 24 hours since the river peaked here and things could n't look more different .
but while there 's no longer water flowing through the streets there 's mud and debris everywhere .
skips have been steadily arriving and they 've been filled within minutes .
everyone has been helping , making the clean-up a little easier .
author: Emily Unia
BBC reporter

documents.title: watch : forty eight hours in the calder valley
text: as the clean-up progresses in the calder valley after major flooding hit towns such as hebden bridge and mytholmroyd , here 's just some of what 's been happening over the past 48 hours .

documents.title: flood warning for mickletown , leeds
text: people living in mickletown , leeds , are being advised to be aware of flood warnings .
the environment agency has issued a warning for the area as a result of the volume of water travelling down the river aire and river calder .

people are being warned by police to take `` any necessary precautions '' , including moving valuables upstairs and making sure they have all they need to hand in case they need to abandon their homes .

documents.title: york flooding : floodwater just feet away from landmark
text: thanks to karen oxtoby for sending in this of floodwater at the very foot of york 's landmark cliffords tower earlier today .
for those who know york , it shows just how far into the city centre the flooding reached .
author: Martin Coldrick
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police warning to flooding 'sightseers '
text: people wanting to view the flooding affecting york city centre and other areas of north yorkshire are being advised to keep away by police .
north yorkshire police 's deputy chief constable , tim madgwick , says : `` many major routes into york and selby are currently flooded and travel in and around these areas is very challenging .
`` routes that are open and passable are critical to emergency services to access to those who need support .
we would ask people who do not need to travel to york , selby and selby district to delay their visit until the flood risk has passed . ''

documents.title: loss of water supplies in rochdale
text: united utilities says it is investigating a loss of water supplies in rochdale , greater manchester .
the company said it had received 60 to 70 calls reporting problems .
it is posting updates for affected customers on its twitter feed .
author: Paul Burnell
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: york : '500 properties still affected '
text: about 500 properties in york are currently directly affected by flooding which has hit the city , york council has just confirmed .
the river ouse , which runs through the city , is currently standing at 5.1m above normal summer levels and is expected to peak at about lunchtime on monday at about 5.3m , the council says .
a second rest centre at the energise leisure centre , on cornlands road , is currently being opened for those affected by flooding in the north of the city .

documents.title: power company plea over christmas lights
text: people in rochdale , greater manchester , are being urged to turn off their christmas lights to help prevent further power cuts after recent flooding .

mark williamson , operations director for electricity north west , says : `` we are asking our customers in rochdale to reduce their energy use to prevent further power outages while our engineers repair the damage .
`` simple things like turning off your christmas lights or not using your washing machine or dishwasher for a while would make a huge difference . ''

documents.title: yorkshire floods : drinking water 'safe '
text: yorkshire water 's just issued this reassurance to its customers worried that flooding in the north of england may affect drinking water .
we can assure drinking water quality has not been affected by the floods and is perfectly safe to drink .
boiling is not required .
# floods .

text: a landslip has hit the major railway route between manchester , preston and blackpool with services being diverted via wigan .
update : landslip at # chorley .
no trains running .

documents.title: lancashire flooding 'as bad as it 's been '
text: mark cowley , a parish councillor in the village of croston in lancashire , where the river yarrow burst its banks , says the flooding there is `` as bad as it 's been '' .
`` people who 've been in the village do n't know it 's ever been this bad and that goes all the way back quite a long time .
`` houses are just under feet of water .

one of my neighbours is under 5ft of water still and until the fire brigade has evacuated all the water then her water 's not going to start going down and she ca n't even start to see how much the devastation is . ''

documents.title: york floods : 'a cup of tea and a stiff upper lip '
text: rob dalby is stuck in his home in york and sent these the scene before it got dark .
he says : `` i 'm stuck in my first-floor apartment on the bank of the river foss .
`` i usually only see the water from one side of the flat .
now it is all i can see !
`` we 're all happy though and keeping a stiff upper lip .
how english we all are in times of crisis !
best have another cup of tea . ''

documents.title: warning over unstable bridges
text: people in calderdale , west yorkshire are being warned to keep away from bridges as several are unstable after flooding in the calder valley .
please stay off footbridges and vehicle bridges as there have been some reports of collapse
@ twitterid where abouts is this bridge ?

documents.title: york council requests thousands of extra sandbags
text: city of york council is now requesting 5,000 additional sandbags as river levels continue to rise in the city .
hundreds of people have been forced to leave their homes here , with water levels having reached record levels .
six severe flood warnings , meaning there 's a danger to life , remain in place in york .
author: Phil Bodmer
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: watch : 'air of unreality ' in york
text: look north 's lara rostron has been in york , reporting from the city which has been hit by extensive flooding .
this is her most recent update from monkgate in the centre of the city .

documents.title: floods hit festive rail travel : 'do n't travel unless absolutely necessary '
text: due to extensive flooding over parts of the north of england , northern rail is advising people not to travel in cumbria , east lancashire and west yorkshire .
they say people should only travel in these areas if the journey is `` absolutely necessary '' .
meanwhile , first transpennine express is advising passengers not to travel between preston and scotland , barrow-in-furness and windermere .

documents.title: your calder valley flooding in hebden bridge and mytholmroyd
text: thanks to maddie gardziel for sending us these of the situation in hebden bridge and mytholmroyd this afternoon .
both towns are among several in the calder valley which have been hit by serious flooding following heavy rain over christmas .

documents.title: a message from space : brit astronaut tim peake sends sympathies
text: he may be orbiting earth at many thousands of miles and hour , but british astronaut tim peake has taken a few moments to express his sympathies for those hit by flooding down at ground level .
passed over uk today - thoughts are with all those affected by flooding in northern england .

documents.title: hemsworth mp : 'i 've never seen anything quite like it '
text: jon trickett , the labour mp for hemsworth , says he 's shocked by the extent of the flooding which has hit northern england .
speaking on the bbc news channel , mr trickett said : `` it is astonishing to drive in from my home through the centre of leeds and see the amount of flooding .
i 've lived in west yorkshire all my life , i 've never seen anything quite like it .
`` we are living in the fifth richest country in the world and i refuse to accept the idea that we 're unable to protect so many people from these kind of events . ''

documents.title: watch : latest aerial shots from flooded york city centre
text: the extent of the flooding which has hit the centre of york is revealed by these shots taken a little earlier from a helicopter flying above the city .
up to 3,500 properties are at risk and between 300 and 400 people are being evacuated .

documents.title: york flooding : 'it 's a nightmare '
text: erica hammill , who runs hotel 53 with her husband michael in the piccadilly area of york , says hotel guests had to climb out of ground floor windows to escape the flooding .
she says : `` it 's a nightmare .
there are no doors at the back for them to get out .
we are getting supplies , sand bags , pumps to mop up the flood damage .
`` but water is coming back in .
we 've lost electrics .
the phone lines and the computer system are down too . ''

documents.title: emergency crews rescue dog in york centre
text: a dog 's been rescued by the emergency services dealing with flooding in york at the moment .
it 's just one of of many animals that have been saved by emergency crews .
great work by the rescue services .
author: Harry Gration
Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: swaledale mountain rescue 'brilliant '
text: filming on rescue boat with the brilliant swaledale mountain rescue team - they 've helped dozens from # yorkfloods
@ twitterid be careful heidi , i don remember you passing your bronze medallion swimming badge

documents.title: power supplies latest in york
text: northern powergrid says it 's closely monitoring the river ouse as flood waters in york are still rising and are not expected to reach their peak until monday .
the company says it has `` response plans in place should the defences be breached at substation sites '' .
northern powergrid 's twitter ( @ northpowergrid ) and facebook pages are also providing regular updates .
author: Trevor Gibbons
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : family rescued from floods in tadcaster
text: these are some of the latest scenes from tadcaster , north yorkshire , where members of the van der berg family have been rescued from their flooded home on wharfe bank terrace .
riley , keagan and dad ben have been stuck in their house since last night as flood waters rose .
ben says : `` the water came so quick .
before we could get everything upstairs , the water just came in and we were stuck upstairs .
it 's absolutely unbelievable . ''

documents.title: police : 'worst flooding in 70 years '
text: west yorkshire police says it has responded to the `` worst flooding in 70 years '' and it has declared a major incident .
about 100 soldiers have been deployed in the hardest-hit areas of calderdale and leeds , police said .
river levels in the river aire peaked last night and are now falling , although about 24 road closures were still in place , the force added .
i want to reassure residents that emergency services are doing all they can and we will continue to do so until this situation improves .
author: Trevor Gibbons
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tadcaster family rescued by fire service
text: tadcaster family rescued by fire service

documents.title: power supplies latest in west yorkshire
text: northern powergrid has about 2,600 homes still to restore power to but has made `` good progress '' to restore about 35,000 homes .
`` customers in the north area of leeds were affected by flooding to our kirkstall c substation on saturday evening which caused three connected primary substations to lose supply .
in leeds city centre we have five distribution substations currently under water , '' the firm said .
author: Trevor Gibbons
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hebden bridge : 'rallying round '

documents.title: pocklington market place under water
text: kimberley fallowfield sent this from market place in pocklington , east yorkshire showing the town on boxing day .
remember if you do send in a flood - make sure you 're safe to do so and keep out of the water .

documents.title: labour : government 'must invest '
text: it is desperately sad to see so many people being affected by heavy rains and flooding again this weekend .
the emergency services are doing an excellent job and communities are showing a tremendous strength of spirit .
however , it is increasingly clear that so-called 'unprecedented ' weather events are here to stay .
the government must also invest in maintaining flood defences , rather than cutting them as they had planned , as well as look urgently at what else can be done to reduce flood risk in future .

documents.title: beauty among the devastation
text: this is a view of the ouse at naburn marina , the original flow of the river should be between the moored boats you can see in the
despite the chaos of the flood water , it is a fine winter 's day at the moment around york .
author: Tim Dale
BBC Local Live

documents.title: turn off your christmas lights in rochdale
text: electricity customers in rochdale are being urged to save power to prevent further blackouts after thousands of homes suffered outages in saturday 's flooding .

mark williamson , operations director for electricity north west , said : `` we are asking our customers in rochdale to reduce their energy use to prevent further power outages while our engineers repair the damage . ''
he added : `` simple things like turning off your christmas lights or not using your washing machine or dishwasher for a while would make a huge difference . ''
author: Paul Burnell
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: eyewitness in baildon : 'it was just horrendous '
text: phillip moncaster , of .
aire close , baildon .
had to rush to rescue his pet and possessions .
we got a flood warning at 10/11pm and i called the environment agency at midnight and they told us not to worry .
when i got up , it was just horrendous , we had no time to prepare .
we got the tv upstairs but all the christmas presents were floating about .
it came in so fast , i had to carry the dog out and within 10 minutes it was over the top of my wellies .
author: Trevor Gibbons
BBC Local Live

documents.title: an eerie feeling in york
text: the swaledale mountain rescue team are working in huntingdon road in york using an inflatable craft to help people caught in the flood water .
the road is close to the river foss and is about 5ft deep in places .
there is an eerie feeling in york as the sun is shining but there has been two to three days of incessant rain in the city .
the river ouse is also flooding and the amount of water in that river is also causing pressure on the foss .
author: Phil Bodmer
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: salford : the clear-up
text: after the flood comes the inevitable clean-up operation .
here 's pete and lilian birtles cleaning up at their home on tucana ave in higher broughton , salford .
author: Paul Burnell
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: river ouse south of york
text: this was taken at naburn on the river ouse , a couple of miles south of york .
the river is still rising locally .
author: Tim Dale
BBC Local Live

documents.title: environment agency
text: there are currently 24 severe flood warnings in place - all in yorkshire .
these mean there is a danger to life in these areas .
the warnings include the rivers aire , calder and foss , and several becks around york .
there are another 154 warnings that flooding is expected and immediate action is required , many of these are also in yorkshire .
others are in wales and lancashire .
author: Trevor Gibbons
BBC Local Live

documents.title: geese survey the debris
text: canada geese survey the debris at mocha parade shopping centre in lower broughton , salford which was flooded by the nearby river irwell.the was taken by bbc radio manchester reporter , michelle adamson .
the was taken by bbc radio manchester reporter , michelle adamson .
author: Paul Burnell
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: york : 'worst i 've ever seen '
text: andy tricklebank , a york resident says : `` a photo of skeldergate in central york this morning , just up the road from where i live .
this is the worst i 've ever seen it , even worse than 2002 .
`` it 's really weird in town , it 's quieter because many roads are closed - it 's just the emergency services and some people jogging .
`` my house is up a hill so i am dry and of course large sections of york are fine .
`` i can see the army , police and environment agency workers hard at it and hear a helicopter overhead . ''
author: Trevor Gibbons
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 50 shelter overnight in bury
text: british red cross volunteers are staffing rest centres in salford and bury , and more than 50 people , mostly elderly residents , spent the night in the bury shelter .
author: Trevor Gibbons
BBC Local Live

documents.title: latest on the uk floods
text: heavy rain has caused more flooding in northern england , with homes evacuated in lancashire and yorkshire , and rivers overflowing in manchester and leeds .
vulnerable people are being evacuated from 2,200 homes in york , where people in 3,500 properties near the river foss have been advised to be ready to leave .
six severe flood warnings - indicating a danger to life - are in place .
author: Trevor Gibbons
BBC Local Live

documents.title: kirkstall road in leeds underwater
text: unbelievable scenes on the a65 kirkstsall road in leeds close to the river aire .
people ca n't believe what they are seeing , it 's like a river .
the viaduct carries the train service from leeds station across one of the main arteries out of the city .
author: Lauren Potts
BBC Local Live

documents.title: eyewitness in lancashire
text: residents have been reflecting on sunday 's evacuation :
the houses in the village had a river going through them .
it happened very quickly and the whole village had to evacuate .
it was a pretty bad situation but everyone is ok .
it is a great village with a strong community .

documents.title: minister : `` defences overwhelmed ''
text: liz truss , environment minister , said the situation across lancashire and yorkshire had been caused by `` unprecedented levels of rain and high river levels '' .
`` we are still in a situation with major flood warnings and we are still working to protect properties and lives . ''
the country 's flood defences would be reviewed in due course , she added .
the prime minister is also to chair an emergency cobra committee today .

documents.title: properties evacuated in york
text: breaking : moutain rescue teams are evacuating properties around the huntington road area .
@ twitterid @ twitterid truly awful
author: Trevor Gibbons
BBC Local Live

documents.title: overwhelming levels on rivers foss and ouse
text: emergency services tackling `` unprecedented levels of flooding '' , according to city of york council after `` overwhelming river levels '' for the foss and ouse .
soldiers have been deployed in the city and road closures include the a59 between the a1 and york and the a19 fulford road .
get the latest news from radio york
author: Trevor Gibbons
BBC Local Live

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live flood coverage
text: hello and welcome to bbc local live in the north of england on sunday 27 december 2015 .
i 'll be with you with the latest news and of the flooding across the north of england .
and please feel free to send me your news , and comments via leeds.locallive @ bbc.co.uk .
author: Trevor Gibbons
BBC Local Live

documents.title: flooding latest
text: our news story will be updated with the latest developments throughout the night .

documents.title: power 'could be off until monday '
text: electricity north west is warning that there will be some homes without power until monday .
the company says there are 9,500 properties without power across the north-west of england .
flood defences at a number of electricity substations have been breached and engineers are `` working round the clock '' to restore power , a statement says .
the company is sending food vans to a number of locations on sunday morning to provide hot food to customers without power .
vans are scheduled to visit radcliffe , padiham and rochdale .

documents.title: search and rescue teams and army in york
text: search and rescue teams and the army have joined the flooding operation in the centre of york .
charlie croft , of city of york council , said they were `` in uncharted territory '' after the river foss pumping station failed and the foss barrier had to be opened .

documents.title: york rest centre
text: thirteen roads in york have been closed after the river foss broke its banks .
york council has set up a rest centre at the archbishop holgate school for people who may be affected by flooding .

documents.title: yorkshire weather warning downgraded
text: the met office red warning for severe weather in north and west yorkshire has been replaced with an amber `` be prepared '' warning .
an estimated 60mm ( 2.4in ) to 120mm ( 5in ) of rain has fallen across the region during the day .

documents.title: north west weather warning downgraded
text: the met office red warning for severe weather in north-west england is no longer in force .
however , the area is now covered by an amber `` be prepared '' warning .
the red warning for north and west yorkshire will remain in place until 22:00 gmt .
